member.name: T:EM.GIS.Data.AffineTransform
member.summary: The AffineTransform class represents a 2D affine transform that performs a linear mapping from 2D coordinates to other 2D coordinates that preserves the "straightness" and "parallelness" of lines. Affine transformations can be constructed using sequences of translations, scales, flips, rotations, and shears.

member.name: M:EM.GIS.Data.AffineTransform.#ctor(System.Double[])
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the 6 specifiable entries of the 3x3 transformation matrix.
member.param: An array with the 6 specifiable entries of the 3x3 transformation matrix.

member.name: P:EM.GIS.Data.AffineTransform.Coefficients
member.summary: Gets or sets the array of coefficients for this transform.

member.name: M:EM.GIS.Data.AffineTransform.CellCenterToProj(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Given any input row or column, this returns the appropriate geographic location for the position of the center of the cell.
member.param: The integer row index from 0 to numRows - 1
The integer column index from 0 to numColumns - 1
member.returns: The geographic position of the center of the specified cell

member.name: M:EM.GIS.Data.AffineTransform.CellTopLeftToProj(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Given the row and column, this returns the geographic position of the top left corner of the cell
member.param: The integer row index from 0 to numRows - 1
The integer column index from 0 to numColumns - 1
member.returns: The geographic position of the top left corner of the specified cell

member.summary: Given the row and column, this returns the geographic position of the top right corner of the cell
member.param: The integer row index from 0 to numRows - 1
The integer column index from 0 to numColumns - 1
member.returns: The geographic position of the top right corner of the specified cell

member.summary: Given the row and column, this returns the geographic position of the bottom left corner of the cell
member.param: The integer row index from 0 to numRows - 1
The integer column index from 0 to numColumns - 1
member.returns: The geographic position of the bottom left corner of the specified cell

member.name: M:EM.GIS.Data.AffineTransform.CellBottomRightToProj(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Given the row and column, this returns the geographic position of the bottom right corner of the cell
member.param: The integer row index from 0 to numRows - 1
The integer column index from 0 to numColumns - 1
member.returns: The geographic position of the bottom right corner of the specified cell

member.name: M:EM.GIS.Data.AffineTransform.TransfromToCorner(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Given the row and column, this returns new affine coefficients transformed to that cell
member.param: The column index from 0 to numColumns - 1
The row index from 0 to numRows - 1
member.returns: Transformed affine coefficients

member.name: T:EM.GIS.Data.Global
member.summary: Global has some basic methods that may be useful in lots of places. TODO: This class needs to be removed and these methods relocated to easier to find places.

member.name: M:EM.GIS.Data.Global.Convert``1(System.Double)
member.summary: Converts a double numeric value into the appropriate T data type using a ChangeType process.
member.typeparam: The numeric output type created from the double value.
member.param: The double value to retrieve the equivalent numeric value for.
member.returns: A variable of type T with the value of the value parameter.

member.name: M:EM.GIS.Data.Global.GetByte(System.Object)
member.summary: This attempts to convert a value into a byte. If it fails, the byte will be 0.
member.param: The expression (like a string) to System.Convert.
member.returns: A byte that is 0 if the test fails.

member.name: M:EM.GIS.Data.Global.GetDouble(System.Object)
member.summary: This attempts to convert a value into a double. If it fails, the double will be double.NaN.
member.param: The expression (like a string) to System.Convert.
member.returns: A double that is double.NAN if the test fails.

member.name: M:EM.GIS.Data.Global.GetFloat(System.Object)
member.summary: This attempts to convert a value into a float. If it fails, the float will be 0.
member.param: The expression (like a string) to System.Convert.
member.returns: A float that is 0 if the test fails.

member.name: M:EM.GIS.Data.Global.GetInteger(System.Object)
member.summary: This attempts to convert a value into an integer. If it fails, it returns 0.
member.param: The expression to test
member.returns: true if the value could be cast as a double, false otherwise

member.name: M:EM.GIS.Data.Global.GetShort(System.Object)
member.summary: This attempts to convert a value into a short. If it fails, it returns 0.
member.param: The expression (like a string) to System.Convert.
member.returns: A short that is 0 if the test fails.

member.summary: A Generic Safe Casting method that should simply exist as part of the core framework

member.param: The original object to attempt to System.Convert.
member.returns: An output variable of type T.

member.name: M:EM.GIS.Data.Global.ToDouble``1(``0)
member.summary: This involves boxing and unboxing as well as a convert to double, but IConvertible was not CLS Compliant, so we were always getting warnings about it. Ted was trying to make all the code CLS Compliant to remove warnings.
member.param: The value that gets converted to double. this should be a numeric.
member.typeparam: Type of the value that gets converted to double.
member.returns: 0 if the type wasn't found otherwise the result of the conversion.

member.name: P:EM.GIS.Data.IRasterBounds.AffineCoefficients
member.summary: 仿射系数 X' = [0] + [1] * Column + [2] * Row Y' = [3] + [4] * Column + [5] * Row

member.name: P:EM.GIS.Data.IReproject.CanReproject
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the DotSpatial.Projections assembly is loaded. If not, this returns false, and neither ProjectionInfo nor the Reproject() method should be used.
member.returns: Boolean, true if the value can reproject.

member.name: P:EM.GIS.Data.IReproject.Projection
member.summary: Gets or sets the projection information for this dataset

member.name: M:EM.GIS.Data.IReproject.Reproject(EM.GIS.Projection.ProjectionInfo)
member.summary: Reprojects all of the in-ram vertices of vectors, or else this simply updates the "Bounds" of image and raster objects This will also update the projection to be the specified projection.
member.param: The projection information to reproject the coordinates to.

member.name: P:EM.GIS.Data.IStatistic.Maximum
member.summary: Gets the maximum data value, not counting no-data values in the grid.

member.name: P:EM.GIS.Data.IStatistic.Mean
member.summary: Gets the mean of the non-NoData values in this grid. If the data is not InRam, then the GetStatistics method must be called before these values will be correct.

member.name: P:EM.GIS.Data.IStatistic.Minimum
member.summary: Gets the minimum data value that is not classified as a no data value in this raster.

member.name: P:EM.GIS.Data.IStatistic.StdDeviation
member.summary: Gets the standard deviation of all the Non-nodata cells. If the data is not InRam, then you will have to first call the GetStatistics() method to get meaningful values.

member.name: M:EM.GIS.Data.RasterBounds.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:EM.GIS.Data.RasterBounds.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. This attempts to read the very simple 6 number world file associated with an image.
member.param: The number of rows in this raster
The number of columns in this raster
A world file to attempt to read

member.name: M:EM.GIS.Data.RasterBounds.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Double[])
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The number of rows for this raster
The number of columns for this raster
The affine coefficients describing the location of this raster.

member.name: M:EM.GIS.Data.RasterBounds.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,EM.GIS.Geometries.IExtent)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class that is georeferenced to the specified envelope.
member.param: The number of rows
The number of columns
The bounding envelope

member.name: P:EM.GIS.Data.RasterBounds.AffineCoefficients
member.summary: Gets or sets the double affine coefficients that control the world-file positioning of this image. X' and Y' are real world coords. X' = [0] + [1] * Column + [2] * Row Y' = [3] + [4] * Column + [5] * Row

member.name: P:EM.GIS.Data.RasterBounds.CellHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the desired height per cell. This will keep the skew the same, but will adjust both the column based and row based height coefficients in order to match the specified cell height. This can be thought of as the height of a bounding box that contains an entire grid cell, no matter if it is skewed.

member.name: P:EM.GIS.Data.RasterBounds.CellWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the desired width per cell. This will keep the skew the same, but will adjust both the column based and row based width coefficients in order to match the specified cell width. This can be thought of as the width of a bounding box that contains an entire grid cell, no matter if it is skewed.

member.name: P:EM.GIS.Data.RasterBounds.Extent
member.summary: Gets or sets the rectangular bounding box for this raster.

member.name: P:EM.GIS.Data.RasterBounds.Height
member.summary: Gets or sets the height of the entire bounds. This is derived by considering both the column and row based contributions to the overall height. Changing this will keep the skew ratio the same, but adjust both portions so that the overall height will match the specified height.

member.name: P:EM.GIS.Data.RasterBounds.NumColumns
member.summary: Gets the number of columns in the raster.

member.name: P:EM.GIS.Data.RasterBounds.NumRows
member.summary: Gets the number of rows in the raster.

member.name: P:EM.GIS.Data.RasterBounds.Width
member.summary: Gets or sets the geographic width of this raster. This will include the skew term in the width estimate, so it will adjust both the width and the skew coefficient, but preserve the ratio of skew to cell width.

member.name: P:EM.GIS.Data.RasterBounds.WorldFile
member.summary: Gets or sets the fileName of the wordfile that describes the geographic coordinates of this raster. If a relative path gets assigned it is changed to the absolute path including the file extension.

member.name: P:EM.GIS.Data.RasterBounds.X
member.summary: Gets or sets the horizontal placement of the upper left corner of this bounds. Because of the skew, this upper left position may not actually be the same as the upper left corner of the image itself (_affine[0]). Instead, this is the top left corner of the rectangular extent for this raster.

member.name: P:EM.GIS.Data.RasterBounds.Y
member.summary: Gets or sets the vertical placement of the upper left corner of this bounds, which is the same as the top. The top left corner of the actual image may not be in this position because of skew, but this represents the maximum Y value of the rectangular extents that contains the image.

member.name: M:EM.GIS.Data.RasterBounds.Clone
member.summary: Returns a duplicate of this object as an object.
member.returns: A duplicate of this object as an object.

member.name: M:EM.GIS.Data.RasterBounds.Copy
member.summary: Creates a duplicate of this RasterBounds class.
member.returns: A RasterBounds that has the same properties but does not point to the same internal array.

member.name: M:EM.GIS.Data.RasterBounds.Open(System.String)
member.summary: Attempts to load the data from the given fileName.
member.param: The file name.

member.name: M:EM.GIS.Data.RasterBounds.Save
member.summary: Attempts to save the data to the file listed in WorldFile

member.name: T:EM.GIS.Data.RasterSet`1
member.summary: A raster of the given type.

member.name: M:EM.GIS.Data.RasterSet`1.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:EM.GIS.Data.RasterSet`1.ByteSize
member.summary: Gets the size of each raster element in bytes.
member.remarks: This only works for a few numeric types, and will return 0 if it is not identifiable as one of these basic types: byte, short, int, long, float, double, decimal, sbyte, ushort, uint, ulong, bool.

member.name: M:EM.GIS.Data.RasterSet`1.ReadRaster(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: This Method should be overrridden by classes, and provides the primary ability.
member.param: The horizontal offset of the area to read values from.
The vertical offset of the window to read values from.
The number of values to read into the buffer.
The vertical size of the window to read into the buffer.
member.returns: The jagged array of raster values of type T.

member.name: M:EM.GIS.Data.RasterSet`1.WriteRaster(`0[][],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: This method reads the values from the entire band into an array and returns the array as a single array. This specifies a window where the xSize and ySize specified and 0 is used for the pixel and line space.
member.param: The one dimensional array of values containing all the data for this particular content.
The horizontal offset of the area to read values from.
The vertical offset of the window to read values from.
The number of values to read into the buffer.
The vertical size of the window to read into the buffer.
